class: A blueprint for creating objects in object-oriented programming, representing a group of related properties and behaviors.
object: An instance of a class that encapsulates data and behavior.
encapsulation: The concept of bundling data and methods that operate on the data within one unit, like a class, restricting access to some components.
inheritance: A mechanism by which one class can inherit fields and methods from another class, promoting code reuse.
polymorphism: The ability of different classes to respond to the same method call in different ways, typically via method overriding or overloading.
